humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, there are metastatic carcinomas in 3 out of 3 assessed lymph nodes in the left axillary contents (part 2) and 2 out of 2 assessed lymph nodes in the left axillary contents (part 3). This means a total of 5 out of 5 assessed lymph nodes have metastatic carcinomas. Based on the AJCC staging system, this corresponds to N2 (N2 indicates metastases in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for cancer staging is determined by the number of involved lymph nodes and the presence of extracapsular extension. In this report, the patient has metastatic carcinoma in 3 of 3 lymph nodes in the left axillary contents (Part 2) and 2 of 2 lymph nodes in the left axillary contents (Part 3), making a total of 5 out of 5 lymph nodes involved. Additionally, extracapsular extension is present in the intra mammary lymph node (Part 1). Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N2.
